question:
Consider the following statements about the Sovereign Gold Bond Scheme:
  1. Minimum investment allowed in the Bond is one gram and maximum is 4 kg for individuals
  2. The bonds bear interest at the rate of 2.50 per cent per annum
  3. The bonds are tradable in the secondary market
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Recently, Government of India in consultation with the Reserve Bank of India has decided to issue the third series-2017-18 of Sovereign Gold Bonds. The sovereign gold bond scheme was first launched in November 2015. SGBs are government securities denominated in grams of gold. It has been launched with an aim to reduce the demand of physical gold in Indian market. The Gold Bond is issued by the Reserve Bank of India on behalf of the Government of India. Minimum investment in the Bond shall be one gram with a maximum limit of subscription of 4 kg for individuals.
